item.title: The latest intel on this loaded free-agent market
item.description: Here's what league execs are now saying about Kawhi Leonard, Kyrie Irving, Jimmy Butler, Kemba Walker and the league's other top free agents.

item.title: Sources: Lakers hustling to create max salary slot
item.description: The Lakers were engaging additional teams on Tuesday to take on the contracts of three players on the roster, trying to create a max salary slot, league sources told ESPN.

item.title: Horford expected to leave Celtics, sources say
item.description: Al Horford is looking to hit free agency and sign a three- or four-year deal outside of Boston, league sources have told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.

item.title: Source: Knicks reject Hawks' offer for No. 3 pick
item.description: The Knicks have declined a recent trade offer that would have sent the No. 3 overall draft pick to the Hawks in exchange for the eighth and 10th picks, a source told ESPN's Jonathan Givony.

item.title: Nats' Scherzer breaks nose during bunting drill
item.description: Nationals pitcher Max Scherzer suffered a broken nose when he took a ball off his face during batting practice on Tuesday. His status for Wednesday's start is to be determined.

item.title: Ex-RB 'He Hate Me' Smart found safe, police say
item.description: Former Eagles and Panthers running back Rod Smart has been found safe, the Lancaster County Sheriff's Office said Tuesday, after he was reported missing in South Carolina.

item.title: MLB, ump's union spar over Machado suspension
item.description: The MLB umpires' union thinks Manny Machado deserved more than a one-game suspension for making contact with an umpire. The league then told the union that its comments were "inappropriate."

item.title: Let Zion Williamson choose where he wants to play next
item.description: Most NBA players work on behalf of bosses, cities, brands and co-workers that they had zero say in choosing. Is that fair?

item.title: USMNT meets Guyana in Gold Cup opener
item.description: Tyler Boyd scored his first two USMNT goals and Paul Arriola and Gyasi Zardes also tallied in Tuesdayâ€™s win.

item.title: Jimmy V Award recipient Rob Mendez: 'It's only the beginning'
item.description: Born without arms and legs, Rob Mendez was determined to become a head football coach. Here, the 2019 recipient of the Jimmy V Award for Perseverance writes a letter to the game that changed his life and allowed him to inspire others.

item.title: Rating the offseason for all 32 teams: Why the Browns are on top
item.description: Did the Browns indeed have the best offseason? Which teams struggled to reach their goals? NFL Nation ranks them and looks toward training camp.

item.title: What they're saying about the first-round quarterbacks of 2019
item.description: With offseason workouts in the books, coaches and peers weigh in with their early impressions of Kyler Murray, Daniel Jones and Dwayne Haskins.

item.title: The 1999 U.S. women's national team: Instant icons, lasting legends
item.description: They were the team that changed it all for women's soccer -- and female athletes. Here are the golden memories of the heroes of '99.

item.title: Reflections from a Chinese-American home during the 1999 Women's World Cup final
item.description: Even while banished to the other room for cheering for the U.S., this 9-year-old felt the world come together during an epic final.

item.title: Sam Kerr's four goals lift Australia to knockout round
item.description: Australia got exactly what it needed against Jamaica: A record night from Sam Kerr, some rest and enough goals to grab second place in Group C.

item.title: Tiger Woods and understanding the new normal
item.description: If, for some reason, you haven't noticed, Tiger Woods isn't 24 anymore. So looking stiff in cold conditions or taking long layoffs between events should stop being a surprise.

item.title: The Ketel Marte All-Stars: How are these guys doing it?
item.description: The Diamondbacks infielder/outfielder already has blown past his career high in home runs, but he's not the only surprising slugger this season.

item.title: James Gallagher: MMA will soon be all about me
item.description: Ahead of Bellator London this weekend, Conor McGregor's teammate and rising star James Gallagher sets his sights on getting to the top of MMA.

item.title: 'There's too much damn turmoil': An unsettling vibe surrounds these Rockets
item.description: Houston's biggest problem might not be Golden State anymore.

item.title: Freddy Adu exclusive: 'I'm not ready to give it up'
item.description: Freddy Adu was supposed to save U.S. soccer before his career fizzled out. But he has found happiness in coaching as he plots his final comeback.

item.title: Fury, Wilder building heavyweight rematch into bigger blockbuster
item.description: Tyson Fury put on a masterful performance Saturday to raise his profile with fans and generate excitement for a second fight with Deontay Wilder. Both men have more work to do, but so far, so good.

item.title: Chasing Ghosts: Can NC State follow UVa out of wilderness?
item.description: NC State has not found a long-term coaching answer since Jim Valvano's ouster in 1990. What has held the Wolfpack back?

item.title: Serena, Sharapova, Federer among top storylines on road to Wimbledon
item.description: Will Serena Williams play a tuneup? Can Andy Murray and Maria Sharapova make successful returns? Those are a few of the burning questions in a short but busy grass-court circuit.

item.title: UFC Fight Night: Saturday at 7 p.m. ET on ESPN+
item.description: null

item.title: 2019 Africa Cup of Nations ultimate preview: Salah, Mane & Co. ready to put on a show
item.description: The Africa Cup of Nations has traditionally been in the winter but with a new summer schedule, expanded field and many top names, it's must-see TV.

item.title: Paul Pogba says he wants a 'new challenge.' How should Man United respond?
item.description: It could be a negotiation tactic or it could be a transfer threat but either way, Paul Pogba's comments will have turned heads in Manchester.

item.title: Why the French GP will be a key race in Ferrari's season
item.description: Ferrari hopes the French Grand Prix will mark a turning point in the development of its 2019 car as it rolls out a number of updates aimed at shifting the fundamental design concept of the SF90.

item.title: Fortnite Pro-Am brings 'Showtime' back to The Forum
item.description: "Showtime" returned to The Forum this weekend as Fortnite pros, along with sports and entertainment celebrities, flocked to the Fortnite Summer Block Party.
